title: What Jeremy Corbyn's tax plan means for you and what you'll pay
text:
Labour proposals would force higher earners to pay effective income tax rates of more than 67pc, landlords would be forced to pay their tenants' council tax bills, and families would lose out on up to £875,000 in inheritance tax breaks.

The 80,000 people currently living as “non-doms” in Britain would also suffer, losing their beneficial tax status – one of the latest Labour policies announced by John McDonnell at the 2019 party conference.

It comes as the Government is already raking in more than ever before from income tax, capital gains tax (CGT) and inheritance tax (IHT).

Alongside other radical policies proposed by Jeremy Corbyn, such as his latest of abolishing independent schools, Labour...
description: Labour proposals would force higher earners to pay effective income tax rates of more than 67pc, landlords would be forced to pay their tenants' council tax bills, and families would lose out on up to £875,000 in inheritance tax breaks.
